instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Finalmente quiero decir que la UE no sólo es una colaboración de carácter comercial.
output: Finally, I want to say that the EU is not only concerned with cooperation on trade.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Como ya tuve ocasión de decir ante este Parlamento, la Comisión está convencida de que, llegado el caso, la Convención debe poder adaptar y desarrollar dichos derechos teniendo en cuenta las circunstancias actuales, en particular las evoluciones tecnológicas y sociales.
output: As I have said before in this House, the Commission is convinced that the Convention must be able, if necessary, to adapt and develop these rights in view of current circumstances, particularly technological and social changes.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: El vertido a los ríos de cianuro y de metales pesados es un ejemplo escalofriante de hasta qué punto las actitudes negligentes hacia el medio ambiente pueden arruinar el entorno por décadas.
output: The cyanide and heavy metals in the rivers are gruesome examples of how environmental negligence may ruin the waterways for decades to come.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: (Algunos aplausos)
output: (Limited applause)

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Dichas preocupaciones son legítimas y fundamentadas.
output: These concerns are legitimate and there are good reasons for them.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: El segundo punto es que deberemos tomar en cuenta la base jurídica con la que puede funcionar la Comisión Europea.
output: The second point is that we must bear in mind the legal basis by virtue of which the European Commission can operate.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Pienso en todas esas propuestas en materia de seguridad alimentaria que son ambiciosas e importantes, y pienso también en la seguridad marítima, después de dos mareas negras que hemos conocido a lo largo de las costas bretonas y en Turquía.
output: These include all the proposals on food safety which are ambitious and important and those on maritime safety which are particularly important given the two oil slicks which have affected the coast of Brittany and Turkey.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: La Comisión deberá ser muy enérgica en las respuestas que dé a algunos de los comentarios que recibirá durante la campaña.
output: The Commission will have to be very vigorous in the responses that it puts out to some of the comments that it will be receiving as part of the campaign.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Debido a que las personas con discapacidad no forman un grupo homogéneo, por ejemplo muchos sordos se consideran una minoría lingüística discriminada por tener su propio lenguaje y cultura, es necesario permitir la definición de algunas asociaciones que son específicas de una discapacidad o de un colectivo en particular, según estipula el apartado 9.
output: Because disabled people do not form one homogenous group - for example many deaf people see themselves as a linguistic minority denied respect for their own language and culture - it is necessary as stated in paragraph 9 to enable some partnerships to be defined which are specific to a particular disability or other group.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Ayer honramos a nuestra institución con un debate político.
output: Yesterday we honoured our institution with a political debate.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Señor Presidente, creo que a pesar de hacer estas observaciones, se mantiene el objetivo común de un uso sostenible de los recursos hidráulicos.
output: In spite of these remarks however, I believe our common objective of sustainable use of water resources can be maintained.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: (EN) En primer lugar, quisiera expresar mi agradecimiento a la Comisión de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural y a su ponente, el presidente de la comisión, Sr. Graefe zu Baringdorf, por haber examinado la propuesta de la Comisión.
output: I should first like to thank the Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development and its rapporteur, the committee chairman, Mr Graefe zu Baringdorf, for examining the Commission's proposal.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Hay que enraizar en el campo cabezas jóvenes creativas.
output: Young, creative individuals must be made to feel an attachment to the countryside.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Sin embargo, para que el mercado interior funcione de forma eficaz y para que la moneda única europea tenga éxito, es fundamental que todas las regiones de Europa, más de 100, puedan competir económicamente en un entorno tan desafiante.
output: But for the internal market to work effectively and for the single European currency to be a success it is important that all regions within Europe, of which there are over 100, can economically compete within this very challenging environment.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: ¿Cuáles son los mecanismos que utilizará para establecer con claridad la igualdad de sexos?
output: What means will the Charter use to ensure that it clearly guarantees equality between the sexes?

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Y con respecto a los acontecimientos de estos días quisiera decir-y lo digo en el día o en el comienzo de semana en que se inicia la Conferencia Intergubernamental- que hay que dar un valor mucho mayor y un realce fundamental al trabajo de la Carta de derechos fundamentales que, después de lo que hemos dicho con motivo de la crisis austríaca, entiendo que verdaderamente debe formar parte de los Tratados.
output: With regard to the events of recent days, I would like to say - and I am saying this on the day, and the week, that the Intergovernmental Conference is starting - we have to place far more value and fundamental emphasis upon the charter on fundamental rights which, given what we have said about the Austrian crisis, I believe should be fully included in the Treaties.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Por lo demás, todos deseamos -no creo engañarme al decirlo- que nunca lleguen a darse esas condiciones de grave y persistente violación de los derechos humanos y de la democracia, ni en relación con Austria ni en relación con ningún otro Estado de la Unión.
output: As a matter of fact I think that I am right in saying that we all hope that these conditions of a serious and persistent breach of human rights and of democracy are never fulfilled, either in Austria or in any other Member State.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Nuestro plan establece los grandes puntos de referencia, las grandes directrices de intervención: primero, el desarrollo de nuevas formas de gobierno para Europa; segundo, la expansión y la ampliación del espacio de paz, libertad y seguridad; tercero, el lanzamiento de una nueva etapa de desarrollo de la economía; cuarto, la protección y la mejora de la calidad de vida.
output: Our programme highlights the major points of reference, the major areas for action: firstly, the development of new forms of governance for Europe; secondly, extension and enlargement of the area of peace, freedom, and security; thirdly, the launch of a new stage in the growth of the economy; fourthly, safeguarding and improving quality of life.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Se ha examinado, sobre todo en los últimos meses, el papel que el Consejo de Desarrollo puede desempeñar en el marco de las políticas de la Unión.
output: As you know, there is a glaring difference between the status of development policies and other EU policies - you only have to look at the difficult circumstances surrounding the EDF' s financing, or rather lack of financing.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: La Comisión se está aproximando cada vez más a los trabajos y las exigencias del Parlamento también en este aspecto.
output: Here again the Commission is increasing its response to the work carried out by and the demands made by Parliament.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Señor Presidente, quisiera empezar por decir que si bastara con palabras para resolver todos los problemas, entonces ya no nos quedaría nada que hacer y podríamos volver tranquilamente a casa.
output: Mr President, I would like to start with the fact that if words could solve the problems we could all pack up and go home.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Un factor importante de esta Directiva es la pregunta de qué hacemos con los componentes para desguace, qué hacemos con los productos triturados.
output: An important part of this directive is the issue of what to do with used parts. What should we do with the shredded products?

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: No hay nada en la resolución sobre el control de las fronteras, y cuando ésta aborda, brevemente, la cuestión de Eurodac o la de los acuerdos de readmisión, es para deplorar la firmeza excesivamente grande del Consejo sobre estos temas.
output: There is absolutely nothing in the resolution on border controls. Even when the question of Eurodac or readmission clauses is briefly mentioned, it is only to deplore the over-strictness of the Council on these subjects.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: De conformidad con orden del día se procede al debate del proyecto definitivo de orden del día tal y como ha quedado establecido por la Conferencia de Presidentes, de conformidad con el artículo 110 del reglamento.
output: The next item is the final version of the draft agenda as drawn up by the Conference of Presidents, pursuant to Rule 110 of the Rules of Procedure.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Los fabricantes han engañado al Sr. Florenz y al Sr. Lange para que presenten aquí unas enmiendas que debilitan considerablemente estas propuestas.
output: The manufacturers have tricked Mr Florenz and Mr Lange into tabling amendments here which seriously weaken these proposals.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Lo esperamos y es la ferviente invitación que dirigimos a nuestros Gobiernos, incluso más allá de las conveniencias.
output: That is what we hope for and is the cordial message that we are sending our governments, even if it goes against their interests.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Albaneses de Kosovo y desertores serbios ven cómo se les rechaza el estatuto de refugiado, mientras Pinochet escapa tranquilamente a su proceso.
output: Kosovo Albanians and Serb deserters are being refused refugee status, whereas Pinochet is calmly escaping prosecution.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: En la propuesta que nos ocupa propongo la eliminación de todas las disposiciones comunitarias actualmente en vigor relativas a la tembladera en las especies ovina y caprina, y transferirlas al marco de la propuesta de directiva.
output: I have proposed in the proposal at hand to delete all currently existing Community rules on scrapie in sheep and goats and to transpose them to the framework proposal for a regulation.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Deseo al Comisario mucha suerte en su lucha dentro de la Comisión, y al Sr. Amado mucho éxito en el Consejo.
output: I would wish the Commissioner all the best in his battle within the Commission and wish Mr Amado the same within the Council.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: No se atreve ni siquiera a llamar las cosas por su nombre y se refugia detrás de una semántica supuestamente de moda para llamar "gobernación" a lo que no es más que un gobierno federal, autocrático y centralizado.
output: You dare not even call a spade a spade, but instead hide behind pseudo-trendy language by using the term 'governance' for what is nothing more than federal, autocratic, centralised government.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Para compensar los efectos negativos de la desaparición temporal de la faja costera en la vida de las aves silvestres, se pensó en mejorar otros espacios aptos para la vida de estas aves en la zona del estuario.
output: Furthermore, to compensate for the negative effects on the bird populations caused by the temporary disappearance of the mudflats, the intention was that other habitats in the estuary should be improved.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: He escuchado con preocupación cuando se refería a nuevos recursos, un concepto que se puede traducir tranquilamente en imposición de nuevos impuestos, con vistas, entre otras cosas, a la ampliación, o sea, al ingreso de nuevos Estados en la Unión.
output: Listening to him just now, I was concerned when he mentioned new resources, something that readily translates as additional taxation, in view, inter alia, of enlargement, that is the entry of new States into the Union.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: El incremento descontrolado de los activos financieros e inmobiliarios significa que los riesgos están también en alza.
output: The unfettered rise in prices of financial assets and property means that the risks are on the increase.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Así pues, debemos mantener en primer lugar los porcentajes de reciclado, porque de esa manera se incentiva naturalmente la renovación tecnológica, con el fin de encontrar una solución acerca del modo de reciclar materiales con los que todavía no sabemos muy bien qué vamos a hacer con ellos.
output: So, first of all, we need to keep the recycling percentages at their present level. This will, of course, provide the necessary incentive for technological innovation and for identifying ways of dealing with materials that we do not as yet know how to dispose of.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Gracias, señor Lannoye.
output: Thank you, Mr Lannoye.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Hemos podido atender las preocupaciones de los países ACP en lo que se refiere al calendario de las negociaciones comerciales.
output: We have met the concerns of the ACP states as far as the time-frame of the trade negotiations is concerned.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Usted debe entablar un diálogo con la sociedad de los ciudadanos.
output: You must embark on a dialogue with the international community.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Por esto, es preciso definir una serie de pasos, con unas normas exigentes, que permitan alcanzar dicho objetivo a largo plazo.
output: We can achieve this long-term objective by developing measures with demanding standards.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: La mayor estabilidad e incluso una mejora de la seguridad social las encontramos en los países del sur.
output: The highest level of stability and even improvement of social security can be found in the southern countries.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Por otra parte, en el informe Berger, en nombre de la simplificación de procedimientos, se introducen enmiendas profundamente discutibles, uno de cuyos ejemplos es la creación de un sistema común de información para el acceso a las tarjetas expedidas por una entidad de cualquier Estado miembro.
output: On the other hand, for the sake of simplifying procedures some highly debatable amendments have been included in the Berger report, one example of which is the establishment of a common information service for cards issued by a body in any Member State.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: El 26 de octubre de 1999, la Comisión Europea adoptó una propuesta para dotar de base legal a la línea presupuestaria dirigida informar a la opinión pública sobre la PAC.
output: On 26 October 1999 the European Commission adopted a proposal to ensure that a legal basis is given to the budget line informing the public about the CAP.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: El agua potable limpia es un derecho de todos nosotros.
output: We are all entitled to clean drinking water.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: También me preocupa, y ya lo he mencionado con anterioridad, el uso del lenguaje, que debe ser sencillo, sin jergas, para que todo el mundo lo entienda.
output: I have also expressed concern in the past about the use of simple language and not using jargon, so that it becomes accessible to everyone.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Porque si no se anula esta PAC ningún programa puede garantizar la supervivencia de los pequeños y medianos agricultores ni la reanimación socioeconómica del campo.
output: Unless this CAP is overthrown, no programme can ensure the survival of small and medium-scale farmers and the social and economic regeneration of the countryside.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: No veo ninguna razón por la cual no se puedan establecer en toda Europa acuerdos de licencia para instalar centros de recogida para gestionar los 8 o 9 millones de vehículos que se desechan anualmente en el seno de la Unión Europea.
output: I see no reason why licensing arrangements cannot be organised across Europe for collection centres to scrap the 8 to 9 million vehicles which are disposed of within the European Union on an annual basis.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Las negociaciones comenzarán en 2002 a más tardar.
output: Negotiations will start no later than 2002.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: En segundo lugar, la aprobación, como parámetros vinculantes en la formulación de los programas de acción en materia de empleo, de las inversiones que han de realizarse en cada Estado y mediante los proyectos comunitarios en los sectores prioritarios de la investigación, de la innovación y de la cualificación del factor humano.
output: Secondly, the approval of investments - where the parameters are binding when drawing up action programmes on employment - to be made in individual countries via Community projects in the priority sectors of research, innovation and training.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: En términos más generales, los partidos signatarios que dirigen o han dirigido los gobiernos de los distintos países de la Unión Europea tienen su parte de responsabilidad en el hecho de que la extrema derecha adquiriese esta influencia, porque adoptaron una política que, por obediencia a los intereses de la gran patronal, no quiere tomar medidas que puedan terminar con el paro y la miseria de él derivada, que facilita la demagogia xenófoba de la extrema derecha.
output: More generally, those signatories who take part in or have taken part in government in the various States of the European Union must take their share of responsibility in the influence which the extreme right has managed to gain since their policy, devoted exclusively to the interests of big business, has not included taking action likely to eradicate unemployment and the poverty it engenders, and has thus facilitated the xenophobic demagoguery of the extreme right.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Señor Presidente, yo tenía previsto volar en el mismo avión y me da vergüenza decir que se trataba de KLM, nuestra compañía aérea nacional.
output: Mr President, I was booked on the same flight and I am rather embarrassed to admit that the airline was KLM, our national airline company.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Mi Grupo se siente especialmente atraído hacia las posibilidades creativas a las que usted ha apuntado con respecto a la perspectiva de presentar en la próxima primavera un Libro Blanco, que aborde el tema de la gobernación.
output: My group is especially attracted to the creative possibilities you signal in regard to the prospect of a White Paper next spring addressing the issue of governance.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: No obstante, hoy, el propio Ministro de Asuntos Europeos que preparó el Tratado de Amsterdam y que al cabo de los años se ha convertido en comisario europeo, el Sr. Barnier, propone que en la próxima Conferencia Intergubernamental se decida que el Consejo trate estas materias por mayoría.
output: Well, today, the same Minister of European Affairs who drew up the Treaty of Amsterdam, who has, in the meantime, become a European Commissioner, Mr Barnier, proposes to decide, at the forthcoming IGC, that the Council will operate in these areas by majority decision.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Hoy ha dado un excelente ejemplo en lo que se refiere al cumplimiento del tiempo de intervención.
output: You have set a very good example of time-keeping today.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Se trata de una esfera en la que se aplica completamente el principio de subsidiariedad.
output: This is an area in which the principle of subsidiarity applies fully.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Finalmente, desde mi propia experiencia en política comunal en una región, industrializada desde hace muchos años y con muchos problemas, quisiera pedirles, estimados colegas, que apoyen especialmente dos puntos del informe que considero esenciales al lado de los aspectos sociopolíticos.
output: From my own experience of local government in an old industrialised region beset with problems, I should like, in conclusion, to ask for your particular support, ladies and gentlemen, for two points in the report which alongside the social policy aspects are, I believe, essential.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: La Unión no debe asumir toda una serie de tareas nuevas sin contar con el requisito básico para garantizar una economía europea próspera.
output: The Union must not take on a whole range of new tasks without the basic foundation for a successful European economy being in place.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Y una última consideración acerca de Internet y de la globalización.
output: One final remark regarding the Internet and globalisation.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: La experiencia demuestra que los proyectos de cooperación han de ser mejor planificados, que el seguimiento de los mismos debe ser más preciso y que es necesario que comporten un rendimiento mayor.
output: Experience shows that projects of cooperation need better planning and closer monitoring and need to be generally more successful.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Afecta a la cuestión de los gastos de reciclaje.
output: It concerns the issue of recycling costs.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Gracias, señora Comisaria.
output: Thank you, Commissioner.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Volvimos a centrar las políticas de desarrollo en estrategias de reducción de la pobreza.
output: We refocus development policies on poverty reduction strategies.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Europa es su población, su historia y ahora su colectividad; pero el motivo por el que Cultura 2000 es tan importante para nosotros es el siguiente: apuesto a que cuando hacemos la pregunta "¿qué es Europa?" , respondemos diciendo "es nuestro arte, es nuestra literatura y es nuestro patrimonio" .
output: Europe is its people, its history and now its collectivity; but the reason why Culture 2000 is so important to us is for this: I will wager that when we ask the question - 'What is Europe?' - we answer it by saying, 'It is our art, it is our literature and it is our heritage.'

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Para nosotros, es decisivo que se consideren los siguientes puntos:
output: For ourselves, it is crucial that the following principles should apply.

instruction: In this task, you are given a sentence in Spanish and your task is to translate it into English. In translation, keep the numbers and capitalization (capitalize only the first word of each sentence and name).
input: Como se recoge en la Agenda 2000, la ampliación no debería traer consigo los conflictos fronterizos los países candidatos.
output: As stated in Agenda 2000 - and I quote: "Enlargement should not mean importing border conflicts".
